unnormalised: ## Discovering the Ancient Wisdom: My Journey with Ayurveda
normalised: ## Discovering the Ancient Wisdom: My Journey with Ayurveda

unnormalised: The hustle and bustle of modern life often leaves us feeling drained, disconnected from ourselves. That's precisely how I felt before I decided to explore the ancient wisdom of Ayurveda. Growing up in Delhi, I'd heard stories from my grandmother about potent remedies made from ingredients found right in our kitchen, but never truly appreciated their value. My journey started quite unexpectedly, after a particularly stressful period at work in October 2022.
normalised: The hustle and bustle of modern life often leaves us feeling drained, disconnected from ourselves. That's precisely how I felt before I decided to explore the ancient wisdom of Ayurveda. Growing up in Delhi, I'd heard stories from my grandmother about potent remedies made from ingredients found right in our kitchen, but never truly appreciated their value. My journey started quite unexpectedly, after a particularly stressful period at work in October two thousand and twenty two.

unnormalised: I’d been experiencing constant fatigue and a nagging headache. After consulting with a few doctors and getting no real relief, my mother suggested I try an Ayurvedic consultation. Reluctant at first, I finally booked an appointment with Dr. Sharma at the Dhanwantari Ayurvedic Centre in Karol Bagh.
normalised: I'd been experiencing constant fatigue and a nagging headache. After consulting with a few doctors and getting no real relief, my mother suggested I try an Ayurvedic consultation. Reluctant at first, I finally booked an appointment with Doctor Sharma at the Dhanwantari Ayurvedic Centre in Karol Bagh.

unnormalised: The consultation itself was unlike anything I'd experienced before. Dr. Sharma spent a good hour asking about my lifestyle, diet, sleep patterns, and even my emotional state. He diagnosed a "Vata imbalance" and prescribed a personalized regimen that included a specific diet, herbal supplements, and Abhyanga (oil massage) treatments.

unnormalised: The first few days were challenging. Adjusting to the diet was difficult – cutting out my beloved spicy chaat was a real struggle! But I persevered. I also started waking up at 06:00 hrs to practice yoga and meditation as prescribed.
normalised: The first few days were challenging. Adjusting to the diet was difficult – cutting out my beloved spicy chaat was a real struggle! But I persevered. I also started waking up at six zero zero hours to practice yoga and meditation as prescribed.

unnormalised: The Abhyanga treatments, using sesame oil infused with herbs like ashwagandha and brahmi, were incredibly soothing. The warm oil, skillfully massaged into my skin, eased the tension I didn't even realize I was holding. I remember one particular session on 14/01/2023, Makar Sankranti, after which I felt a profound sense of calm and well-being.

I remember one particular session on fourteenth january two thousand and twenty three, Makar Sankranti, after which I felt a profound sense of calm and well-being.

unnormalised: Slowly but surely, I started feeling a shift. My headaches became less frequent, my energy levels improved, and I felt more grounded. It's been about 6 months since I began my Ayurvedic journey, and I can honestly say it's been transformative. It's not just about treating symptoms; it's about understanding my body’s unique constitution (Prakriti) and creating balance. I even visited a Panchakarma retreat in Kerala for 7 days last month, a truly immersive experience!

unnormalised: While I still occasionally indulge in my Delhi street food cravings, I’m now much more mindful of my choices. Ayurveda has taught me to listen to my body and nourish it with wholesome foods and practices. It's a journey, not a destination, and I’m excited to continue exploring its depths. If you’re feeling lost or disconnected, I highly recommend exploring the wisdom of Ayurveda. It might just be the missing piece you've been searching for.
